name: Indian Subcontinent
overview: The Indian Subcontinent is always in danger of suffering huge power outages if the players increase their networks too fast. Additionally, the players must buy their resources on a limited resource market, which not always guarantees enough resources for all players. The garbage power plants use livestock manure and have a low efficiency. When producing electricity they need one additional garbage.

preparation.content: Resources begin at: coal 1 Elektro, oil 2 Elektro, garbage 2 Elektro and uranium 6 Elektro. Use only 8 uranium tokens during the game.
Before preparing the power plant deck, remove power plant #11.
Each player may buy just 1 resource token per buying turn for the first several turns.

notes.content: In »Step 1« only the resource market areas for 1 to 3 Elektro are accessible.
At the start of »Step 2« the areas for 4 and 5 Elektro are added.
At the start of »Step 3« the whole market is accessible.  Refill the most expensive spaces first, even if these spaces are not available for use.
Always refill the most expensive spaces first, even if these spaces are not available for use.
The garbage power plants need 1 additional garbage token to produce electricity, but they do not store more garbage.
Players must power as many cities in their networks as possible.

If players caused a power outage during Building (new buildings greater than twice the number of players), each player must subtract 3 Elektro from total income for each connected city in his network.
